title: Changelog
text: notable changes rnaseqDegy documented file. format follows Keep Changelog (https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.1.0/) project adheres Semantic Versioning (https://semver.org/).

title: Changelog
text: Initial release rnaseqDegy, unified bulk RNA-seq pipeline R package. Count filtering (‚â•10 counts ‚â•50% samples). QC: PCA (/without batch correction), sample correlation heatmap, top 500 variable-gene heatmap. Differential expression (DESeq2 edgeR) batch correction integrated design. Enhanced volcano plots gene counts top 10 labels. ORA (GO BP/MF/CC) via clusterProfiler (dotplot, barplot, cnetplot, emapplot). GSEA using user-supplied offline GMT files (dotplot, barplot, cnetplot, emapplot). Added run_rnaseqDegy() high-level wrapper function R workflow integration. Internal modular engine located inst/scripts/engine_internal.R. Added comprehensive documentation roxygen tags. README.md LICENSE (MIT) CITATION.cff CONTRIBUTING.md NAMESPACE DESCRIPTION

title: Changelog
text: first stable functional version package. Future versions expand enrichment options (KEGG, Reactome), introduce multi-contrast support, add automated HTML reporting.

title: Changelog
text: Support KEGG/Reactome ORA + GSEA. Optional batch-aware normalization choices (e.g., RUVseq, ComBat‚ÄëSeq). Multi-contrast DE support. Automated QC/DE report (HTML via rmarkdown). Extending species support (rat, drosophila). Shiny app wrapper interactive use.

title: Contributing to rnaseqDegy
text: Thank interest contributing rnaseqDegy! welcome contributions researchers, students, developers, anyone interested improving bulk RNA‚Äëseq workflows. document describes contribution process, coding standards, expectations contributors.

title: Contributing to rnaseqDegy
text: Navigate :https://github.com/ebareke/rnaseqDegy Click Fork create copy GitHub account.

title: Contributing to rnaseqDegy
code: git clone https://github.com/<your-username>/rnaseqDegy.git cd rnaseqDegy

title: Contributing to rnaseqDegy
text: Use meaningful branch names (e.g., bugfix/pca-labels, feature/add-kegg-support).
code: git checkout -b feature/my-new-feature

title: Contributing to rnaseqDegy
text: ‚Äôll need: - R ‚â• 4.2 - RStudio (recommended) - devtools, roxygen2, BiocManager Install dependencies:
code: install.packages(c("devtools", "roxygen2")) BiocManager::install(c("DESeq2","edgeR","limma","clusterProfiler","enrichplot"))

title: Contributing to rnaseqDegy
text: loads package without installing .
code: devtools::load_all()

title: Contributing to rnaseqDegy
code: devtools::test()

title: Contributing to rnaseqDegy
text: Whenever update functions: update NAMESPACE .Rd files.
code: devtools::document()

title: Contributing to rnaseqDegy
text: Write clear concise commits.
code: git add . git commit -m "Added new PCA auto-scaling feature"

what: 9. Push and Open a Pull Request
title: Contributing to rnaseqDegy
text: go GitHub open Pull Request (PR). Provide: - clear description change - Motivation (matters) - visual examples (plots, error messages, etc.) - Impact downstream functionality
code: git push origin feature/my-new-feature

title: Contributing to rnaseqDegy
text: Follow tidyverse style conventions Use meaningful variable names (vst_mat, norm_counts, etc.) Avoid deeply nested logic possible Add inline comments clarity

title: Contributing to rnaseqDegy
text: Every exported function must : - Title - Description - Arguments - Value - Examples appropriate

text: paths must function arguments constructed output_dir.

title: Contributing to rnaseqDegy
text: Ensure: - Deterministic output possible - Documented random seeds - Clear logging (message() calls)

text: Please use GitHub Issue Tracker: üëâ https://github.com/ebareke/rnaseqDegy/issues Include: - Operating system - R version - Package version - Error logs - Minimal reproducible example possible

title: Advanced rnaseqDegy Workflows
text: vignette shows advanced usage patterns rnaseqDegy, including: Custom filtering thresholds Running pipeline edgeR instead DESeq2 Enabling GO ORA GSEA user-supplied GMTs Running multiple contrasts Tips HPC scripting assume already read Introduction vignette.

title: Advanced rnaseqDegy Workflows
code: library(rnaseqDegy)  counts <- system.file("extdata", "example_counts.tsv", package = "rnaseqDegy") design <- system.file("extdata", "example_design.tsv", package = "rnaseqDegy")

title: Advanced rnaseqDegy Workflows
text: can relax tighten expression filtering criteria change correlation method:
code: run_rnaseqDegy(   counts = counts,   design = design,   species = "human",   de_method = "DESeq2",   condition_reference = "Control",   condition_test = "Mutant",   filter_min_count = 5,     # instead of default 10   filter_min_prop  = 0.4,   # instead of default 0.5   corr_method      = "spearman",   batch_correction = TRUE,   run_ora = FALSE,   run_gsea = FALSE,   output_dir = "rnaseqDegy_advanced_filter" )

what: 2. Using edgeR as the DE Engine
title: Advanced rnaseqDegy Workflows
text: use edgeR differential expression: rnaseqDegy automatically: Fit GLM ~ batch + group Compute QL F-tests Harmonize output columns log2FoldChange padj
code: run_rnaseqDegy(   counts = counts,   design = design,   species = "human",   de_method = "edgeR",   condition_reference = "Control",   condition_test = "Mutant",   batch_correction = TRUE,   alpha = 0.01,      # stricter FDR cutoff   lfc_cutoff = 1.5,  # higher fold-change threshold   run_ora = FALSE,   run_gsea = FALSE,   output_dir = "rnaseqDegy_edgeR" )

title: Advanced rnaseqDegy Workflows
text: enable GO ORA, simply set run_ora = TRUE: Internally, pipeline: Uses expressed genes background (universe) Selects significant DEGs using alpha lfc_cutoff Maps symbols ENTREZ IDs Runs clusterProfiler::enrichGO() BP, MF, CC Simplifies terms semantic similarity (simplify()) following files created: ORA_GO_BP.tsv, ORA_GO_MF.tsv, ORA_GO_CC.tsv ORA_GO_<ONT>_dotplot.pdf/png ORA_GO_<ONT>_barplot.pdf/png ORA_GO_<ONT>_cnetplot.pdf/png ORA_GO_<ONT>_emapplot.pdf/png
code: run_rnaseqDegy(   counts = counts,   design = design,   species = "human",   de_method = "DESeq2",   condition_reference = "Control",   condition_test = "Mutant",   run_ora = TRUE,   run_gsea = FALSE,   output_dir = "rnaseqDegy_ORA" )

what: 4. Running GSEA with Offline GMT Files
title: Advanced rnaseqDegy Workflows
text: use GSEA must provide: gmt_dir: directory containing GMT files gmt_files: character vector GMT filenames Example GMT layout: Example call: GMT file, pipeline: Ranks genes log2FC Runs clusterProfiler::GSEA() Writes GSEA_<gmt_name>.tsv Creates dotplot, barplot, cnetplot, emapplot
code: gmt/  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ HALLMARK.v2023.1.Hs.symbols.gmt  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ C5.GO.BP.v2023.1.Hs.symbols.gmt run_rnaseqDegy(   counts = counts,   design = design,   species = "human",   de_method = "DESeq2",   condition_reference = "Control",   condition_test = "Mutant",   run_ora = FALSE,   run_gsea = TRUE,   gmt_dir = "gmt",   gmt_files = c(     "HALLMARK.v2023.1.Hs.symbols.gmt",     "C5.GO.BP.v2023.1.Hs.symbols.gmt"   ),   output_dir = "rnaseqDegy_GSEA" )

previous_headings: 4. Running GSEA with Offline GMT Files
title: Advanced rnaseqDegy Workflows
text: Optionally, can restrict plots subset terms using gmt_terms:
code: run_rnaseqDegy(   counts = counts,   design = design,   species = "human",   de_method = "DESeq2",   condition_reference = "Control",   condition_test = "Mutant",   run_ora = TRUE,   run_gsea = TRUE,   gmt_dir = "gmt",   gmt_files = c("HALLMARK.v2023.1.Hs.symbols.gmt"),   gmt_terms = c("HALLMARK_APOPTOSIS", "HALLMARK_INFLAMMATORY_RESPONSE"),   output_dir = "rnaseqDegy_focus_terms" )

title: Advanced rnaseqDegy Workflows
text: rnaseqDegy focuses one contrast per call, can script multiple contrasts: pattern particularly useful HPC clusters, contrast can launched separate job.
code: contrasts <- list(   list(ref = "Control", test = "Mutant"),   list(ref = "Control", test = "Treatment2") )  for (c in contrasts) {   outdir <- sprintf("rnaseqDegy_%s_vs_%s", c$ref, c$test)    run_rnaseqDegy(     counts = counts,     design = design,     species = "human",     de_method = "DESeq2",     condition_reference = c$ref,     condition_test = c$test,     batch_correction = TRUE,     run_ora = TRUE,     run_gsea = FALSE,     output_dir = outdir,     prefix = sprintf("%s_vs_%s", c$ref, c$test)   ) }

title: Advanced rnaseqDegy Workflows
text: Use absolute paths counts, design, gmt_dir, output_dir. Keep output_dir unique job/contrast. can wrap run_rnaseqDegy() inside small R script call Rscript scheduler (SLURM, PBS, etc.). Example SLURM command (shell-level):
code: Rscript -e "rnaseqDegy::run_rnaseqDegy(\   counts = 'counts.tsv', \   design = 'design.tsv', \   species = 'human', \   de_method = 'DESeq2', \   condition_reference = 'Control', \   condition_test = 'Mutant', \   batch_correction = TRUE, \   run_ora = TRUE, \   run_gsea = FALSE, \   output_dir = 'rnaseqDegy_job1')"

title: Advanced rnaseqDegy Workflows
text: Installation issues: Ensure Bioconductor dependencies (DESeq2, edgeR, clusterProfiler, etc.) installed BiocManager::install(). significant DEGs: Try relaxing alpha lfc_cutoff, verify design sample size. ORA/GSEA empty: Ensure enough DEGs ORA (e.g., ‚â• 10) GMT identifiers match gene identifiers (symbols).

title: Advanced rnaseqDegy Workflows
text: vignette illustrated advanced control filtering, DE engines, enrichment options, multi-contrast workflows. Combined introductory vignette, now able integrate rnaseqDegy interactive analyses production pipelines. questions feature requests, please open issue : https://github.com/ebareke/rnaseqDegy/issues

title: Introduction to rnaseqDegy
text: rnaseqDegy provides fully automated end--end bulk RNA‚Äëseq pipeline human mouse datasets. Starting raw count matrix sample design file, performs QC, differential expression (DESeq2/edgeR), enhanced visualization, comprehensive functional enrichment (ORA GSEA using offline GMTs). vignette demonstrates minimal reproducible workflow.

title: Introduction to rnaseqDegy
code: # Install devtools if not installed install.packages("devtools")  # Install rnaseqDegy from GitHub devtools::install_github("ebareke/rnaseqDegy")

title: Introduction to rnaseqDegy
text: Must contain: - Column 1: gene IDs (Ensembl Gene Symbol) - Remaining columns: integer raw counts Example:
code: GeneID   S1   S2   S3   S4 ENSG1    50   23   11   9 ENSG2    140  180  90   76

title: Introduction to rnaseqDegy
text: Must contain exactly: - Sample - Batch - Condition Example: Example input files provided :
code: Sample   Batch   Condition S1       B1      Control S2       B1      Control S3       B2      Mutant S4       B2      Mutant system.file("extdata", "example_counts.tsv", package = "rnaseqDegy") system.file("extdata", "example_design.tsv", package = "rnaseqDegy")

title: Introduction to rnaseqDegy
text: produces: - PCA plots - Sample correlation heatmap - Top variable-gene heatmap - Differential expression results - Volcano plot Enrichment analyses (ORA/GSEA) can enabled setting run_ora = TRUE, run_gsea = TRUE providing GMTs.
code: library(rnaseqDegy)  counts <- system.file("extdata", "example_counts.tsv", package = "rnaseqDegy") design <- system.file("extdata", "example_design.tsv", package = "rnaseqDegy")  run_rnaseqDegy(   counts = counts,   design = design,   species = "human",   de_method = "DESeq2",   condition_reference = "Control",   condition_test = "Mutant",   batch_correction = TRUE,   run_ora = FALSE,   run_gsea = FALSE,   output_dir = "rnaseqDegy_example" )

title: Introduction to rnaseqDegy
code: de_method = "DESeq2"   # default # OR de_method = "edgeR"

title: Introduction to rnaseqDegy
code: alpha = 0.05     # FDR threshold lfc_cutoff = 1   # abs(log2FC) cutoff

title: Introduction to rnaseqDegy
text: Enabled : Uses: - clusterProfiler::enrichGO() - simplify() redundancy reduction Outputs: - Dotplot - Barplot - Cnet plot - Emap plot
code: run_ora = TRUE

title: Introduction to rnaseqDegy
text: Requires: - gmt_dir: folder containing GMT files - gmt_files: character vector GMT filenames Example: Outputs: - Dotplot - Barplot - Cnetplot - Emapplot - Ranked GSEA results table
code: run_rnaseqDegy(   ...,   run_gsea = TRUE,   gmt_dir = "gmt/",   gmt_files = c("HALLMARK.gmt", "GO_BP.gmt") )

title: Introduction to rnaseqDegy
text: Set: Uses: limma::removeBatchEffect() applied VST-transformed data.
code: batch_correction = TRUE

what: PCA before vs after batch correction
title: Introduction to rnaseqDegy
text: versions automatically generated based option.

title: Introduction to rnaseqDegy
text: Correlation method controlled :
code: corr_method = "pearson"  # default # or "spearman", "kendall"

title: Introduction to rnaseqDegy
text: running, output_dir contains:
code: QC_PCA_*.pdf/png QC_sampleCorrelation.pdf/png QC_topVar500_heatmap.pdf/png DE_results_all.tsv normalized_counts.tsv DE_volcano.pdf/png ORA_GO_BP_*.tsv + plots ORA_GO_MF_*.tsv + plots ORA_GO_CC_*.tsv + plots GSEA_<gmt>_*.tsv + plots

title: Introduction to rnaseqDegy
code: sessionInfo()

title: Introduction to rnaseqDegy
text: rnaseqDegy provides streamlined, powerful, fully automated workflow RNA‚Äëseq differential expression enrichment analysis. ideal HPC batch pipelines everyday command‚Äëline usage. issues feature requests, visit: https://github.com/ebareke/rnaseqDegy/issues

what: üöÄ Unified Bulk RNA‚Äëseq QC, Differential Expression, and Enrichment Pipeline
title: rnaseqDegy
text: Author: Dr.¬†Eric Bareke (Majewski Lab, McGill University)Repository: https://github.com/ebareke/rnaseqDegy rnaseqDegy R package providing single, fully automated pipeline bulk RNA‚Äëseq analysis ‚Äî covering QC, differential expression, GO ORA, GSEA using user‚Äësupplied GMT files, human mouse datasets. package designed research labs, HPC clusters, automated workflows, offering clean, reproducible, publication‚Äëready outputs.

title: rnaseqDegy
text: Count filtering (‚â•10 counts ‚â•50% samples) PCA (optional batch correction via limma::removeBatchEffect) Sample correlation heatmap (Pearson/Spearman/Kendall) Top 500 variable gene heatmap Auto‚Äëdimensioned plots publication‚Äëready styling

code: # Install devtools if not present install.packages("devtools")  # Install rnaseqDegy from GitHub devtools::install_github("ebareke/rnaseqDegy")

title: rnaseqDegy
text: generate: - QC plots - DE tables + volcano - ORA (BP/MF/CC) - GSEA (GMT) Outputs auto‚Äënamed saved PDF + PNG.
code: library(rnaseqDegy)  run_rnaseqDegy(   counts = "counts.tsv",   design = "design.tsv",   species = "human",   de_method = "DESeq2",   condition_reference = "Control",   condition_test = "Mutant",   batch_correction = TRUE,   run_ora = TRUE,   run_gsea = TRUE,   gmt_dir = "gmt/",   gmt_files = c("HALLMARK.gmt", "GO_BP.gmt"),   output_dir = "results/Control_vs_Mutant",   prefix = "C_vs_M" )

title: run_rnaseqDegy ‚Äî run_rnaseqDegy
text: Unified bulk RNA-seq pipeline QC, DE (DESeq2/edgeR), ORA GSEA. Accepts file paths parameters R function arguments (wrapper around original CLI pipeline). outputs written chosen directory.

title: run_rnaseqDegy ‚Äî run_rnaseqDegy
code: run_rnaseqDegy(   counts,   design,   species = "human",   de_method = "DESeq2",   condition_reference,   condition_test,   filter_min_count = 10,   filter_min_prop = 0.5,   batch_correction = TRUE,   corr_method = "pearson",   alpha = 0.05,   lfc_cutoff = 1,   run_ora = TRUE,   run_gsea = TRUE,   gmt_dir = NULL,   gmt_files = NULL,   gmt_terms = NULL,   output_dir = "rnaseqDegy_output",   prefix = NULL )

title: run_rnaseqDegy ‚Äî run_rnaseqDegy
text: counts Path count matrix (TSV) design Path design matrix (TSV) species "human" "mouse" de_method "DESeq2" "edgeR" condition_reference Reference condition condition_test Test/contrast condition filter_min_count Minimum count per sample (default 10) filter_min_prop Minimum proportion samples (default 0.5) batch_correction Logical, PCA batch correction (TRUE/FALSE) corr_method Correlation method: "pearson", "spearman", "kendall" alpha FDR cutoff (default 0.05) lfc_cutoff Log2FC threshold (default 1) run_ora Logical, run ORA run_gsea Logical, run GSEA gmt_dir Directory containing GMT files gmt_files Character vector GMT filenames gmt_terms Optional character vector GO/GMT terms output_dir Output directory prefix Optional prefix output files

title: run_rnaseqDegy ‚Äî run_rnaseqDegy
text: Invisibly returns output directory path.
